description: Errors where graphic assets are misaligned between XML declaration and Illust section: 'file missing in Illust', 'file missing in XML declaration', 'found in Illust but missing in XML', 'Mismatch in files'. Includes asset types: figs, fx, ga, gr, mmc, sc. Examples: grf1 file missing, extra fx file in XML.

Errors where an element with a specific identifier must appear in the document but is missing. Key phrases: 'An element with the identifier' followed by ID 'must appear in the document'. IDREF target not found. Examples: element with identifier au1 must appear, element with identifier fig1 must appear, element with identifier tab1 must appear, element with identifier enun_H1 must appear.

Errors where element content must match a required pattern but does not: 'The content of element type X must match'. Child sequence or structure violates schema requirements. Examples: content of element type article must match, content of element type sec must match, content must follow specific pattern with children.

Errors where ID/IDREF/IDREFS attribute values are malformed: NCName violations, spaces in IDREFS, invalid naming rules. Examples: 'ID value contains space', 'IDREFS value must be NMTOKEN', 'NCName constraint violation', identifiers with invalid characters.

category_name: Invalid Para Or Character Style Present
description: Errors where element types (tags/elements) are not declared in the DTD: 'Element type "[name]" must be declared'. These are undeclared ELEMENT TYPES, not entities. The element tag itself needs DTD declaration. Common examples: custom elements like fontstyle21, Heading2Char, listparagraph, htmlpreformatted, missing_para, SubtleEmphasis, anchor-text, conflictofinterest, displayeqntext, keywordsjel, pargraph, stlt, tab, tclass, text, unknown-tag, unknownfont, unsupportedsymbol. These are typically custom style names, formatting tags, and paragraph styles. NOT about entity references with ampersands (&entity;) which are category 7.

Errors where element content is incomplete because required child elements are missing: 'The content of element type X is incomplete, it must match pattern'. Key word is INCOMPLETE. Required elements are absent. Examples: content of element type article is incomplete, content of element type sec is incomplete, missing required child like title or body.

Errors where ID attribute values are duplicated: 'Attribute value of type ID must be unique', 'ID already defined', duplicate identifier in document. Examples: ID value fig1 used multiple times, duplicate id attribute value sec1.

Errors about entity references (&entity;) that are problematic: 'The entity "[name]" was referenced, but not declared', 'The reference to entity "[name]" must end with the ';' delimiter', 'The entity name must immediately follow the '&' in the entity reference'. These are specifically about ENTITY REFERENCES using ampersands (&Amp;, &NBSP;, –, ⋅, &Wu;), not element tags. Includes SAXParseException messages about entity references. Examples: entity Amp not declared, entity NBSP not declared, reference to ndash must end with semicolon, entity name must follow ampersand.

Errors where the id attribute specifically is required but not provided or not declared: 'Attribute "id" is required and must be specified for element type', 'Attribute "id" must be declared for element type'. Specifically about ID attribute only, not other attributes like month, year, type, xml:lang, or refid. Examples: id required for bib-reference, id required for correspondence, id required for footnote, id must be declared for ce:label.

Errors about element tags not being properly closed or terminated: 'The element type "[name]" must be terminated by the matching end-tag', 'The end-tag for element type "[name]" must end with a '>' delimiter', closing tags missing or malformed. Includes SAXParseException messages about end-tag delimiters and termination. Key phrases: 'must be terminated', 'matching end-tag', 'end-tag', '>' delimiter. Examples: ce:author must be terminated by matching end-tag, end-tag for ce:author must end with > delimiter.

Errors where attribute values have incorrect format or don't match required data type constraints: 'Attribute "[name]" with value "[value]" must have a value from the list', 'Attribute value "[value]" of type NMTOKEN must be a name token'. Focuses on attribute VALUE format problems, not element declarations. Examples: view attribute with value 'cs' or 'Cs' must be from enumeration list, attribute value '23â€“26' must be valid NMTOKEN (name token), attribute values violating format constraints or containing invalid characters like dashes in NMTOKEN.
